title: [Large-scale] Postmodern Mathematics Problem-Solving Project Based on 21st-Century Learning Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and digital tool application skills
context.additional_context: Learners are office/administrative professionals who need to develop non-standardized problem-solving thinking for practical tasks and must be familiar with collaborative learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: They can mathematically model real-world problems using various digital tools and propose nonlinear solutions.
They can apply self-directed learning strategies during iterative improvements through peer feedback.

In team-based projects (4 members), learners identify ≥3 mathematical problem-solving conflicts (e.g., algorithm selection, model design), propose ≥2 creative solutions using brainstorming and design thinking techniques, and submit an implementation report after team consensus on one solution.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
